title: Big thank you to the Riot Balance Team.
body:
I just wanted to give you guys a big shout out because i think the current metagame is the most balanced and diverse that i have seen in long, long time. It's commonly called the "Tank meta" but i think this is a bit of a misnomer, because almost every lane and champion archetype  is in a good place. Tanks are finally viable, but they aren't so strong they push other classes out. Because tanks can finally peel again, ADC's are good again. Because ADC's are good again, assassins are still strong but not overbearing. Because Assassins are not overbearing, it doesn't feel like shit to pick mages. Champion diversity is the best its been in a long time. Finally i'm not seeing Lee Sin literally every damn game... and you didn't have to nerf lee to oblivion for it to happen! It seems their are very few OP picks that are stifling diversity. 

I find myself watching LCS again after about a year. It's not the same small pool of champions over and over and over. You can no longer reliably predict who wins the match after the first 10 minutes. We've seen the rise of support Nautilus, top Morgana, support kennen and FREAKING URGOT in competitive play. This speaks volumes about how well you're accomplishing your stated goals this year. Hell i'm watching Bjergsen wreck C9 with AP Kogmaw in the finals right now. 

Balance is far from perfect. Old champions need work, itemization could be better, etc, but you guys are on the right track. These are the kinds of changes i've been waiting whole seasons for. Thanks from a long time player.

I've never thought anyone should be able to 100-0. I believe a healthy burst champion should be able to 50-0. If you can nuke someone at full health and kill them without a response it's pretty lame and boring.
Unless you can 100-0 and get yourself killed in the process. Like Ahri having to use **all** of her dashes for damage.

100-0 is the whole basis of assassins, which are key to balancing out hyper carries. Without their burst it would be the Protect the Vayne vs Protect the Kog comp every game with top mega tanks JG with peel (sej and nunu/gragas) mid with shields (ori lulu karma etc.) supports with sustain/peel to keep the carry in lane (nami Janna (shield with AP Janna can keep you in lane surprisingly well) and soraka) and of course ADC Vayne/kog/Jinx? and it would have very limited counterplay if you remove the ability to 100-0.

Now should every champ be able to instakill? No, should champs designed to deal very high burst damage very fast and then be relatively less impactful rest of the fight be able to 100-0? Yes, because without that they lose their usefulness. Imagine a Zed unable to instakill a carry, what role would he play in any team comp? To lower the ADC health so they can sustain it back up with BoRk/BT?

Mundo is a Fighter, not a tank. Durability has nothing to do with being a tank. Somebody like J4 is a tank, because he has hard CC and durability. Mundo is a fighter because he has DPS and durability.

EDIT: Because this obviously wasn't clear, I meant Durability does not make you a tank *when comparing tanks and fighters* DPS makes you a fighter, CC makes you a tank. There is overlap, but Mundo is a fighter, where somebody like Nautilus is a tank.
So you would call Janna a tank, because she has CC. You would call Garen a fighter, however, because he doesn't?

No, I meant when comparing a tank to a fighter.

Fighter=tanky DPS
Tank=tanky disruptor

Garen is a fighter, because he is a source of DPS, rather than good CC.

People that build full durability but still do damage are tanks for one simple reason. Their damage isn't for killing people, it's part of their kit, so they can force people to do something about them. They disrupt fights by doing enough damage to need to be peeled.

I didn't put words in his mouth, I extended his argument to its logical conclusion.

There are only two reason that you would WANT a carry to be "more relevant".
Either A: You play carries and you want to feel like you are more important than your teammates.
Or B: You DON'T play carries and want to "get carried", without being responsible for making major contributions to your team.

I gave him the benefit of the doubt, and assumed A.
In hindsight after reading his other posts and looking up his record, I probably should not have made that assumption.

However you want to look at it, those are the conclusions to the argument of "Carries should be more relevant".

If you want to view that as putting words in his mouth, so be it.
